summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham begat Isaac; Isaac begat Jacob; Jacob begat Judas and his brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; Phares begat Esrom; Esrom begat Aram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aram begat Aminadab; Aminadab begat Naasson; Naasson begat Salmon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salmon begat Booz {Greek word for “Boaz”} of Rachab; Booz begat Obed of Ruth; Obed begat Jesse;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesse begat David the king; David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon begat Roboam; Roboam begat Abia; Abia begat Asa;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asa begat Josaphat; Josaphat begat Joram; Joram begat Ozias;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ozias begat Joatham; Joatham begat Achaz; Achaz begat Ezekias;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezekias begat Manasses; Manasses begat Amon; Amon begat Josias;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josias begat Jechonias and his brothers, about the time they were carried away to Babylon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; Salathiel begat Zorobabel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zorobabel begat Abiud; Abiud begat Eliakim; Eliakim begat Azor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azor begat Sadoc; Sadoc begat Achim; Achim begat Eliud;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliud begat Eleazar; Eleazar begat Matthan; Matthan begat Jacob;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations; from the carrying away into Babylon unto the Christ are fourteen generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this: That being, his mother Mary espoused to Joseph (before they came together) she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph her husband, being just and not willing to expose her publicly, desired to leave her secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in dreams, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife; for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus, for he shall save his people from their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a virgin shall conceive and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being interpreted is God With Us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph, being aroused from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him and took unto him his wife
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and knew her not until she had brought forth her firstborn son, and he called his name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? We have seen his star in the east and are come to worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he asked them where the Christ should be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea, for thus it is written by the prophet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda, for out of thee shall come a Leader that shall shepherd my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, calling the wise men unto him secretly, understood of them with diligence the time of the appearing of the star;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sending them to Bethlehem, he said, Go there and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again that I may come and worship him also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, behold, the star, which they had seen in the east, went before them until it arrived and stood over where the young child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And entering into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother; and falling down, they worshipped him; and opening their treasures, they offered him gifts: gold and frankincense and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being warned by divine revelation in dreams that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in dreams, saying, Arise and take the young child and his mother and flee into Egypt and remain there until I bring thee word, for Herod will seek the young child to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And awaking, he took the young child and his mother by night and departed into Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, seeing that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth and sent forth and killed all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the borders thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had understood of the wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by the Lord through Jeremiah the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation and weeping and great mourning, Rachel was weeping for her children and would not be comforted because they perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared in dreams to Joseph in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Arise and take the young child and his mother and go into the land of Israel, for they are dead who sought the death of the young child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose and took the young child and his mother and came into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus reigned in Judaea in the place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there; notwithstanding, being warned by divine revelation in dreams, he withdrew into the parts of Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the prophets, that he shall be called a Nazarene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, Repent ye, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah, who said, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord; make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same John had his raiment of camel’s hair and a leathern girdle about his loins, and his food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jerusalem and all Judaea and all the region round about Jordan went out to him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were baptized of him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who taught you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham as our father, for I say unto you that God is able to raise up children unto Abraham of these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now the axe is also laid unto the root of the trees; therefore, every tree which does not bring forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I indeed baptize you in water unto repentance, but he that comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear; he shall baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose fan is in his hand; and he will thoroughly purge his threshing floor and gather his wheat into the storehouse, but he will burn up the chaff with fire that shall never be quenched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to Jordan unto John to be baptized of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John resisted him much, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it to be so now, for thus it is expedient for us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffered him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus, after he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water; and, behold, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and lighting upon him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, behold, a voice from the heavens, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, afterwards he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou art the Son of God, command that these stones be made into bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him up into the holy city and set him on a pinnacle of the temple
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down, for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee, and in their hands they shall bear thee up lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, the devil took him up into an exceeding high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto him, All these things I will give thee if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, Get thee hence, Satan, for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he returned to Galilee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Zebulun, and the land of Naphtali, by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the people who sat in darkness saw great light, and to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, light is sprung up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say, Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brothers, Simon, called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they straightway left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going on from there, he saw another two brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and he called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they immediately left the ship and their father and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the gospel of the kingdom and healing every sickness and every bodily weakness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his fame went throughout all Syria; and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with diverse diseases and torments and those who were possessed with devils and those who were lunatic and those that were paralyzed; and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, from Decapolis, from Jerusalem, from Judaea and from beyond Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into the mountain; and when he had sat down, his disciples came unto him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he opened his mouth and taught them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are those that mourn, for they shall be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called the sons of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are those who suffer persecution for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are ye when men shall revile you and persecute you and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely for my sake.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rejoice and be exceeding glad, for great is your reward in the heavens; for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its savour, with what shall it be salted? From then on it is good for nothing, but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot of men.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye are the light of the world. A city set upon a mountain cannot be hid.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Neither do men light a lamp and put it under a bushel, but on the lampstand, and it gives light unto all that are in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Think not that I am come to undo the law or the prophets; I am not come to undo, but to fulfil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For verily I say unto you, Until heaven and earth pass away, not one jot or one tittle shall pass from the law until all is fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall undo one of these least commandments and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of the heavens; but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not commit murder, and whosoever shall commit murder shall be guilty of the judgment;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother out of control shall be in danger of the judgment, and whosoever shall insult his brother shall be in danger of the council, but whosoever shall say, Thou art impious, shall be in danger of hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there remember that thy brother has something against thee;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave thy gift there before the altar, and go; first restore friendship with thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Conciliate with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out of there, until thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not commit adultery;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say unto you, That whosoever looks on a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore if thy right eye should bring thee occasion to stumble, pluck it out and cast it from thee; for it is better for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if thy right hand should bring thee occasion to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for it is better for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It was also said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a bill of divorce;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, except for the cause of fornication, causes her to commit adultery; and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, ye have heard that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not perjure thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by the heaven, for it is God’s throne,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor by the earth, for it is his footstool, neither by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head because thou canst not make one hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But let your communication be, Yes, yes; No, no; for whatsoever is more than this comes of evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I say unto you, That ye resist not with evil, but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if anyone desires to sue thee at the law, and take away thy clothing, let him have thy cloak also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him two.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to him that asks of thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless those that curse you, do good to those that hate you, and pray for those who speak evil about you, and persecute you;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that ye may be sons of your Father who is in the heavens, for he makes his sun to rise on the evil and on the good and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if ye love those who love you, what reward shall ye have? Do not even the publicans the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if ye embrace your brethren only, what do ye more than others? Do not even the publicans so?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father who is in the heavens is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Take heed not to do your alms {lit. acts of mercy} before men, to be seen of them; otherwise, ye have no reward of your Father who is in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They already have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that thine alms may be in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret, he shall reward thee openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are, for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They already have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy chamber, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret shall reward thee openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions as the worldly do, for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them, for your Father knows what things ye have need of before ye ask him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye, therefore, are to pray like this: Our Father who art in the heavens, Hallowed be thy name.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And set us free from our debts, as we set free our debtors.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil, for thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if ye set men free from their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also set you free;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but if ye do not set men free from their trespasses, neither will your Father set you free from your trespasses.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance, for they disfigure their faces that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They already have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But thou, when thou dost fast, anoint thine head, and wash thy face
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father, who sees in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust corrupt and where thieves do not break through nor steal;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The lamp of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye is sincere, thy whole body shall be full of light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if thine eye is evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If, therefore, the light that is in thee is darkness, how great is that darkness!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and riches.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat or what ye shall drink, nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than food, and the body than raiment?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold the fowls of the air, for they sow not, neither do they reap nor gather into barns, yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they toil not, neither do they spin;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is and tomorrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, With what shall we be clothed?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: (For the Gentiles seek after all these things.) For your heavenly Father knows that ye have need of all these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow, for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the affliction thereof.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For with the judgment with which ye judge, ye shall be judged, and with the measure with which ye measure, ye shall be measured again.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why dost thou behold the mote that is in thy brother’s eye but dost not consider the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam is in thine own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou be able to see to cast out the mote out of thy brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet and turn again and rend you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: for every one that asks receives, and he that seeks finds, and to him that knocks it shall be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or what man is there of you, whom, if his son asks for bread, will he give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if he asks for fish, will he give him a serpent?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father who is in the heavens give good things to those that ask him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, all things whatsoever ye desire that men should do unto you, so also shall ye do unto them, for this is the law and the prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Enter ye in at the narrow gate, for the way that leads to destruction is wide and spacious, and those who follow it are many;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: because narrow is the gate, and confined is the way which leads unto life, and there are few that find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Keep yourselves also from the false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Even so every good tree brings forth good fruit, but a corrupt tree brings forth evil fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every tree that does not bring forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So that by their fruits ye shall know them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of the heavens, but he that doeth the will of my Father who is in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And then I will profess unto them, I never knew you; depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, whosoever hears these words of mine and does them, I will liken him unto a prudent man, who built his house upon the rock;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and the rain descended, and the rivers came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house, and it did not fall, for it was founded upon a rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And every one that hears these words of mine and does not do them shall be likened unto a foolish man, who built his house upon the sand;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and the rain descended, and the rivers came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house, and it fell; and great was the fall of it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these words, the multitude marvelled at his doctrine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he taught them as one having authority and not as the scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was come down from the mountain, many people followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, a leper came and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou art willing, thou art able to cleanse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou clean. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, See thou tell no one; but go, show thyself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus was entering into Capernaum, a centurion came unto him, beseeching him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, Lord, my servant lies at home paralyzed, grievously tormented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, I will come and heal him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou should come under my roof; but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me; and I say to this man, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my slave, Do this, and he does it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, he marvelled and said to those that followed, Verily I say unto you that not even in Israel have I found such faith.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, That many shall come from the east and west and shall sit down at the table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the sons of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto the centurion, Go, and as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee. And his servant was healed in that same hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus was come into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother lying in bed and with fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she arose and ministered unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils, and he cast out the spirits with the word and healed all that were sick
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying, He took our infirmities and bore our sicknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he commanded that they depart unto the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain scribe came and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee wherever thou goest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven have nests, but the Son of man has nowhere to lay his head.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto him, Follow me, and let the dead bury their dead.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, there arose a great moving in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves; but he was asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples came to him and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us; we perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then, awake, he rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this that even the winds and the sea obey him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with demons, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God? Art thou come here to torment us before the time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a good way off from them a herd of many swine feeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Go. And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine; and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea and perished in the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that fed them fled and went into the city and told everything and what was befallen to the ones possessed of the demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus; and when they saw him, they besought him that he would depart out of their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered into a ship and passed over and came into his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, they brought him a paralyzed man, lying on a bed; and Jesus, seeing their faith, said unto the paralyzed man, Trust, son; thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Why think ye evil in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For what is easier, to say, Thy sins are forgiven thee, or to say, Arise, and walk?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins (then said he to the paralyzed man), Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he arose and departed to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude, seeing it, marvelled and glorified God, who had given such power unto men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus passed forth from there, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom; and he said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he sat at food in his house, behold, many publicans and sinners that had come sat down at the table with Jesus and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why does your Master eat with publicans and sinners?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard that, he said unto them, Those that are whole need not a physician, but those that are sick.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore go ye and learn what this is, I will have mercy and not sacrifice, for I am not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the disciples of John came to him, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but thy disciples do not fast?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Can the sons of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then they shall fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one mends an old garment with a piece of new cloth, for that patch takes from the garment, and the rent is made worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither do they put new wine into old wineskins, otherwise the wineskins break, and the wine runs out, and the wineskins perish; but they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved together.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While he spoke these things unto them, behold, a certain ruler came and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead; but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus arose and followed him, and so did his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, a woman who was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years came behind him and touched the hem of his garment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned around, and when he saw her, he said, Trust, daughter; thy faith has made thee free. And the woman was free from that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said unto them, Give place, for the maid is not dead, but sleeps. And they laughed him to scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the people were put forth, he went in and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fame of this went abroad into all that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, Thou Son of David, have mercy on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him; and Jesus said unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yes, Lord.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no one knows it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a demon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the demon was cast out, the dumb man spoke; and the multitude marvelled, saying, Such a thing has never been seen in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said, He casts out demons through the prince of the demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the gospel of the kingdom and healing every sickness and every weakness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw the multitude, he was moved with compassion on them because they fainted and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then calling his twelve disciples, he gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of weakness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: the first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee and John his brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Canaanite and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twelve Jesus sent forth and commanded them, saying, Do not go into the way of the Gentiles, and do not enter into any city of the Samaritans,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of the heavens has come.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out demons; freely ye have received, freely give.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Provide neither gold nor silver nor money in your girdles,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor bag for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes nor a staff, for the workman is worthy of his food.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And into whatever city or town ye shall enter, search out with diligence who in it is worthy; and there abide until ye go from there.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And entering into the house, salute it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if the house is worthy, your peace shall come upon it; but if it is not worthy, your peace shall return to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whosoever shall not receive you nor hear your words, depart out of that house or city and shake off the dust of your feet.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of those of Sodom and those of Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves; be ye therefore prudent as serpents and innocent as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But keep yourselves from men, for they will deliver you up in councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and ye shall even be brought before princes and kings for my sake, for testimony unto them and to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak, for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And brother shall deliver up brother unto death, and the father the child, and children shall rise up against their parents and cause them to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name, but he that endures to the end shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another, for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel until the Son of man be come.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The disciple is not above his master, nor the slave above his lord.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the slave as his lord. If they have called the husband of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call those of his household?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Fear them not therefore, for there is nothing covered that shall not be revealed, nor hid that shall not be known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in light, and what ye hear in the ear, that preach ye from the housetops.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And fear not those who kill the body but are not able to kill the soul, but rather fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? And one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Fear ye not, therefore; ye are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I also confess before my Father who is in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father who is in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Think not that I have come to introduce peace into the land; I came not to introduce peace, but a sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I have come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And a man’s foes shall be those of his own household.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and he that loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he that does not take his cross {Gr. Stauros – stake} and follow after me is not worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that finds his life shall lose it, and he that loses his life for my sake shall find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that receives you receives me, and he that receives me receives him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward, and he that receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished giving commandments to his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of the Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and tell John those things which you hear and see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk; the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear; the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is he who is not offended in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, those that wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is he of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there has not risen a greater than John the Baptist; notwithstanding, he that is least in the kingdom of the heavens is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the days of John the Baptist until now, life is given unto the kingdom of the heavens, and the valiant take hold of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye will receive it, this is that Elijah who was to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But unto whom shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets and shouting unto their fellows
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He has a devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a gluttonous man and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified by her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done because they repented not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to Hades, for if the mighty works which have been done in thee had been done in those of Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment than for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus answered and said, I praise thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and understanding and hast revealed them unto children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, Father, for thus it was pleasing in thy sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are delivered unto me of my Father, and no one has known the Son but the Father, neither has anyone known the Father except the Son and he unto whom the Son will reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take my yoke upon you and learn of me, for I am meek and humble of heart, and ye shall find rest for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the planted fields, and his disciples were hungry and began to pluck the ears of grain and to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, and those that were with him, when he was hungry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered into the house of God and ate the showbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath and are blameless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, That in this place is one greater than the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye knew what this means, I will have mercy and not sacrifice, ye would not condemn the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was departed from there, he went into their synagogue;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, behold, there was a man who had his hand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days? that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you that shall have one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, how much more is a man worth than a sheep? So that it is lawful to do good on the sabbath days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it forth; and it was restored whole, like the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went out and took council against him that they might destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus knew it, he withdrew himself from there; and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and strictly charged them that they should not make him known;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that it which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, who said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold my servant, whom I have chosen, my beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased; I will put my Spirit upon him, and he shall declare judgment unto the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not strive nor cry, neither shall anyone hear his voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bruised reed he shall not break, and a smoking flax he shall not quench until he sends forth judgment unto victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in his name shall the Gentiles wait.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a demon, blind, and dumb, and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spoke and saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people were amazed and said, Is not this the son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This fellow does not cast out demons but by Beelzebub the prince of the demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus knew their thoughts and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself shall not remain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom remain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out demons, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out the demons by the Spirit of God, then certainly the kingdom of God is come unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else how can one enter into the strong man’s house and spoil his goods except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is not with me is against me, and he that does not gather with me scatters abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit shall not be forgiven unto men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever speaks a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him, but whosoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this age, neither in the age to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or else make the tree corrupt and its fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good man out of the good treasure of the heart brings forth good things, and the evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we desire to see a sign from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and there no sign shall be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as Jonah was three days and three nights in the whale’s belly, so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in the judgment with this generation and shall condemn it because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and, behold, a greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation and shall condemn it, for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of the man, it walks through dry places, seeking rest, and finds none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it says, I will return into my house from which I came out; and when it is come, it finds it empty, swept, and garnished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and takes with itself seven other spirits worse than itself, and they enter in and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it also be unto this wicked generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet talked to the people, behold, his mother and his brothers stood without, desiring to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brothers stand without, desiring to speak with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brothers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father who is in the heavens, the same is my brother and sister and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the sea side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great multitude was gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship and sat, and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke many things unto them in parables, saying, Behold, the sower went forth to sow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he sowed, some of the seed fell beside the way, and the fowls came and devoured them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth; and forthwith they sprang up because they had no deepness of earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some fell into good ground and brought forth fruit: one a hundredfold and another sixtyfold and another thirtyfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came and said unto him, Why dost thou speak unto them in parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of the heavens, but to them it is not given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever has, to him shall be given, and he shall have in abundance; but whosoever has not, from him shall be taken away even that which he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I speak to them in parables because seeing they see not, and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which says, By hearing ye shall hear and shall not understand, and seeing ye shall see and shall not perceive;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this people’s heart is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed lest at any time they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears and should understand with their heart and should be converted, and I should heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see, and your ears, for they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see and have not seen them and to hear those things which ye hear and have not heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, then the wicked one comes and catches away that which was sown in his heart. This is he who was planted beside the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that was planted in stony places, the same is he that hears the word and receives it immediately with joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet he has no root in himself but is temporal, for when affliction or persecution arises because of the word, by and by he is offended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that was planted among the thorns is he that hears the word, and the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that was planted in good ground is he that hears the word and understands it and who also bears the fruit and brings forth: one a hundredfold and another sixty and another thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put forth another parable unto them, saying, The kingdom of the heavens is likened unto a man who sows good seed in his field
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the blade was sprung up and brought forth fruit, then the tares appeared also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the slaves of the husband of the house came and said unto him, Lord, didst thou not sow good seed in thy field? From where then does it have tares?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, The enemy, a man, has done this. The slaves said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, No, lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put forth another parable unto them, saying, The kingdom of the heavens is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which indeed is the smallest of all the seeds, but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the heaven come and make their nests in its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke another parable unto them: The kingdom of the heavens is like unto leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal until the whole was leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke all these things unto the multitude in parables and said nothing unto them without parables
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house, and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said unto them, He that sows the good seed is the Son of man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the field is the world; the good seed are the sons of the kingdom, but the tares are the sons of the wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so shall it be in the end of this age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend and those who do iniquity
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire; there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like unto treasure hid in the field, which when found, a man hides it and, for the joy thereof, goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like unto a net that was cast into the sea and gathered of every kind of fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which, when it was full, they drew to shore and sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall it be at the end of the age; the angels shall come forth and separate the wicked from among the just
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire; there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Have ye understood all these things? They answered unto him, Yes, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Therefore every scribe who is instructed in the kingdom of the heavens is like unto a man, a husband of a house, who brings forth out of his treasure things new and old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished and said, From where does this man have this wisdom and these mighty works?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the carpenter’s son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brothers, James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sisters, are they not all with us? From where then does this man have all these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour except in his own country and in his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto his slaves, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do show forth themselves in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had laid hold on John and bound him and put him in prison for Herodias’ sake, his brother Philip’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude because they counted him as a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod’s birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatever she would ask.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John the Baptist’s head in a platter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king was sorry; nevertheless because of the oath and of those who sat with him at the table, he commanded it to be given her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent and beheaded John in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his head was brought in a platter and given to the damsel, and she brought it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples came and took up the body and buried it and went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard of it, he departed from there by ship into a desert place apart; and when the people had heard of it, they followed him on foot out of the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went forth and saw a great multitude and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away that they may go into the villages and buy themselves food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto them, They need not depart; give ye them to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, We have here but five loaves and two fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, Bring them here to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass and took the five loaves and the two fishes; and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke and gave the loaves to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were filled, and they took up of the fragments that remained, twelve baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that had eaten were about five thousand men besides women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship and to go before him unto the other side while he sent the multitude away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had sent the multitude away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray; and when the evening was come, he was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves, for the wind was contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fourth watch of the night, Jesus went unto them, walking upon the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples saw him walking upon the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a ghost; and they cried out for fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But straightway Jesus spoke unto them, saying, Trust that I AM; be not afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me to come unto thee upon the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Come. And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked upon the water to go to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seeing that the wind was strong, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying, Lord, save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand and caught him and said unto him, O thou of little faith, why didst thou doubt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Truly thou art the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him, they sent out into all that country round about and brought unto him all that were sick
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment, and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain scribes and Pharisees of Jerusalem came unto Jesus, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother, and, He that curses father or mother, let him die without recourse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, Whatever I might have helped thee with is already my offering unto God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now has no need to honour his father or his mother with succour. Thus ye have made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye hypocrites, well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This people draws nigh unto me with their mouth and honours me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in vain do they worship me, teaching doctrines and commandments of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And calling the multitude unto him, he said unto them, Hear and understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not that which goes into the mouth defiles the man; but that which comes out of the mouth, this defiles the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples came and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this word?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, Every plant which my heavenly Father has not planted shall be rooted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them alone; they are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into a pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not ye yet understand that whatever enters in at the mouth goes into the belly and is cast out into the draught?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart, and they defile the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these are the things which defile the man, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left there and departed into the parts of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, a woman of Canaan having come out of the same borders cried unto him, saying, Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me; my daughter is sick, possessed by a demon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away, for she cries out after us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she came and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, It is not good to take the children’s bread and to cast it to the little dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, Yes, Lord, yet the little dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.
verses.speaker: Narrator
